item.title: "Hello World!" Linux Kernel Module
item.description: What is a kernel module? Kernel modules are the pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand. They extend the functionality of the kernel without the need to reboot the system. The device drivers, networking stack; for almost everything you will find a module in the kernel. To use the kernel module there are three specific tools/commands that you will need. $ lsmod # List all existing modules in the kernel.

item.title: R305 fingerprint module + python
item.description: This is the post regarding the Python-R305 package. R305 is a very common finger print sensor. It is quite cheap, has a storage capacity of 250 fingerprints. I came across this module about one and a half year ago. I had to use it in a small project with Raspberry-Pi. At that time I couldn’t find a python API that covers all of the functionality provided by the module.
